https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_India_doctors%27_strike

Day 2: 12 June 2019
As protests entered the second day on 12 June 2019, patients across West Bengal were left without healthcare as junior doctors continued with the strike. On the same day, the agitation of intern doctors at the NRSMCH spilled over to all thirteen state-run hospitals and medical colleges in the city and at least six other district hospitals,[9] causing disruption of regular medical services.[2][3] Affected hospitals include the Calcutta National Medical College Hospital, Calcutta Medical College and Hospital and SSKM Hospital, R G Kar Hospital and medical colleges in Murshidabad, Midnapore, North Bengal and Bankura.[9] All departments, including out-patient departments and pathological laboratories were shutdown following the protests of the junior doctors. Protestors said that work will not resume at the hospitals until full protection is given to medical professionals.[1][2] Contrary to statements by the Doctors' Forum, emergency wards at at least three state-run hospitals, NRSMCH,[4] SSKM Hospital[22] and Burdwan Medical College remained closed.[7]
